original: Majjhima Nikāya 71
analyzed: majjhima nikāya
translated: Middle Length Discourses

original: Tevijjavacchasutta
analyzed: tevijjavacchasutta
translated: The Discussion with Vacchagotta on the Three Knowledges

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā vesāliyaṁ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṁ.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā vesāliyam viharati mahā vane kūṭāgāra sālāya
translated: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Vesālī in the Great Wood in the hall with the peaked roof.

original: Tena kho pana samayena vacchagotto paribbājako ekapuṇḍarīke paribbājakārāme paṭivasati.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena vacchagottaḥ paribbājakaḥ ekapuṇḍarīke paribbājaka ārāme paṭivasati
translated: Now on that occasion the wanderer Vacchagotta was staying in the Single-Jewel Monastery of the wanderers.

original: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya vesāliṁ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya vesālim piṇḍāya pāvisi
translated: Then, in the morning, the Blessed One dressed and, taking bowl and robe, entered Vesālī for alms.

original: Atha kho bhagavato etadahosi:
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavataḥ
translated: Then it occurred to him:

original: “atippago kho tāva vesāliyaṁ piṇḍāya carituṁ;
analyzed: atippago kho tāva vesāliyam piṇḍāya caritu
translated: “It is still too early to walk for alms in Vesālī.

original: yannūnāhaṁ yena ekapuṇḍarīko paribbājakārāmo yena vacchagotto paribbājako tenupasaṅkameyyan”ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham yena ekapuṇḍarīkaḥ paribbājaka ārāmaḥ yena vacchagottaḥ paribbājako tena upasaṅkameyyanti
translated: Let me go to the Single-Jewel Monastery of the wanderers to see the wanderer Vacchagotta.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā yena ekapuṇḍarīko paribbājakārāmo yena vacchagotto paribbājako tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā yena ekapuṇḍarīkaḥ paribbājaka ārāmaḥ yena vacchagottaḥ paribbājako tena upasaṅkami
translated: Then the Blessed One went to the Single-Jewel Monastery of the wanderers to see the wanderer Vacchagotta.

original: Addasā kho vacchagotto paribbājako bhagavantaṁ dūratova āgacchantaṁ.
analyzed: addasā kho vacchagottaḥ paribbājakaḥ bhagavantam dūratas vā āgacchanta
translated: The wanderer Vacchagotta saw the Blessed One coming in the distance

original: Disvāna bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: disvāna bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and said to him:

original: “Etu kho, bhante, bhagavā.
analyzed: etu kho bhante bhagavā
translated: “Come, Blessed One!

original: Svāgataṁ, bhante, bhagavato.
analyzed: svāgata bhante bhagavato
translated: Welcome, Venerable Sir!

original: Cirassaṁ kho, bhante, bhagavā imaṁ pariyāyamakāsi yadidaṁ idhāgamanāya.
analyzed: cirassam kho bhante bhagavā imam pariyāyam akāsi yat idam idha āgamanāya
translated: It’s been a long time since you took the opportunity to come here.

original: Nisīdatu, bhante, bhagavā idamāsanaṁ paññattan”ti.
analyzed: nisīdatu bhante bhagavā idam āsanam paññattanti
translated: Please, Venerable Sir, sit down; this seat is ready.”

original: Nisīdi bhagavā paññatte āsane.
analyzed: nisīdi bhagavā paññatte āsane
translated: The Fortunate One sat down on the prepared seat,

original: Vacchagottopi kho paribbājako aññataraṁ nīcaṁ āsanaṁ gahetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: vaccha gottaḥ api kho paribbājakaḥ aññataram nīcam āsanam gahetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: and Vacchagotta the wanderer, after taking a low seat, sat down on one side.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho vacchagotto paribbājako bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho vacchagottaḥ paribbājakaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: While sitting on one side Vacchagotta the wanderer said this to the Fortunate One:

original: “sutaṁ metaṁ, bhante:
analyzed: sutam mā ita bhante
translated: “I have heard this, reverend Sir:

original: ‘samaṇo gotamo sabbaññū sabbadassāvī, aparisesaṁ ñāṇadassanaṁ paṭijānāti,
analyzed: samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ sabbaññū sabba dassāvī aparisesam ñāṇa dassanam paṭijānāti
translated: ‘The ascetic Gotama claims to be all-knowing, all-seeing, to have all-knowing-&-seeing knowledge right now;

original: carato ca me tiṭṭhato ca suttassa ca jāgarassa ca satataṁ samitaṁ ñāṇadassanaṁ paccupaṭṭhitan’ti.🔽Ye te, bhante, evamāhaṁsu: ‘samaṇo gotamo sabbaññū sabbadassāvī, aparisesaṁ ñāṇadassanaṁ
analyzed: carataḥ ca me tiṭṭhataḥ ca suttassa ca jāgarassa ca satatam samitam ñāṇa dassanam paccupaṭṭhitanti 🔽ye te bhante evam āhasu samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ sabbaññū sabba dassāvī aparisesam ñāṇa dassana
translated: and that his knowledge & vision is uninterrupted whether he is walking or standing or sleeping or awake.’🔽Those who say this, reverend Sir, do they say what has been said by the Fortunate One, and not misrepresent him with what is not fact, and do they explain in accordance with the Dhamma, so that no one who holds the Dhamma could have grounds for criticism?”

original: paṭijānāti, carato ca me tiṭṭhato ca suttassa ca jāgarassa ca satataṁ samitaṁ ñāṇadassanaṁ
analyzed: paṭijānāti carataḥ ca me tiṭṭhataḥ ca suttassa ca jāgarassa ca satatam samitam ñāṇa dassana
translated: and that this knowledge and vision is constantly and continuously present to me whether I am walking, standing, sleeping or awake.’

original: paccupaṭṭhitan’ti, kacci te, bhante, bhagavato vuttavādino, na ca bhagavantaṁ abhūtena🔽abbhācikkhanti, dhammassa cānudhammaṁ byākaronti, na ca koci sahadhammiko vādānuvādo
analyzed: paccupaṭṭhitan ti kacci te bhante bhagavataḥ vutta vādinaḥ na ca bhagavantam abhūtena  abbhācikkhanti dhammassa ca anudhammam byākaronti na ca koci sahadhammikaḥ vādānuvādo
translated: Are those who say this speaking in accordance with what has been said by the Buddha, and not misrepresenting him with an untruth?

original: gārayhaṁ ṭhānaṁ āgacchatī”ti?🔽“Ye te, vaccha, evamāhaṁsu: ‘samaṇo gotamo sabbaññū sabbadassāvī, aparisesaṁ ñāṇadassanaṁ
analyzed: gārayham ṭhānam āgacchati iti  ye te vaccha samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ sabbaññū sabba dassāvī aparisesam ñāṇa dassana
translated: Do they explain in accordance with the Dhamma in such a way that nothing which provides a ground for censure can be legitimately deduced from their assertion?”

original: paṭijānāti, carato ca me tiṭṭhato ca suttassa ca jāgarassa ca satataṁ samitaṁ ñāṇadassanaṁ
analyzed: paṭijānāti carataḥ ca me tiṭṭhataḥ ca suttassa ca jāgarassa ca satatam samitam ñāṇa dassana
translated: “Vaccha, those who say that I declare that a monk has a knowledge and vision that is constantly and continuously present to him whether he is walking, standing, sleeping or awake,

original: paccupaṭṭhitan’ti, na me te vuttavādino, abbhācikkhanti ca pana maṁ asatā abhūtenā”ti.
analyzed: paccupaṭṭhitanti na me te vutta vādinaḥ abbhācikkhanti ca pana mamam asatā abhūtena ati
translated: are not speaking in accordance with what has been said by me, but are misrepresenting me with what is untrue and contrary to fact.”

original: “Kathaṁ byākaramānā pana mayaṁ, bhante, vuttavādino ceva bhagavato assāma, na ca
analyzed: katham byākaramānā pana bhante vutta vādinaḥ ca iva bhagavataḥ assāma na ca
translated: “But, Lord, how should we answer if we are to state what has been said by the Lord and not misrepresent him with what is contrary to fact?

original: bhagavantaṁ abhūtena abbhācikkheyyāma, dhammassa cānudhammaṁ byākareyyāma, na ca
analyzed: bhagavantam a bhūtena abbhācikkheyyāma dhammassa ca anudhammam byākareyyāma na ca
translated: we would misrepresent the Buddha and misrepresent his Teaching.

original: koci sahadhammiko vādānuvādo gārayhaṁ ṭhānaṁ āgaccheyyā”ti?
analyzed: koci sahadhammikaḥ vāda anuvādaḥ gārayham ṭhānam āgaccheyya ati
translated: And no one could reasonably criticize us for doing so.”🔽“Vaccha, if you were to declare: ‘The ascetic Gotama is a magician,’ you would be speaking words that are unfactual,

original: “‘Tevijjo samaṇo gotamo’ti kho, vaccha, byākaramāno vuttavādī ceva me assa, na ca🔽maṁ abhūtena abbhācikkheyya, dhammassa cānudhammaṁ byākareyya, na ca koci sahadhammiko🔽vādānuvādo gārayhaṁ ṭhānaṁ āgaccheyya.
analyzed: tevijjaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ iti kho vaccha byākaramānaḥ vutta vādī ca iva me assa na ca  mam a bhūtena abbhācikkheyya dhammassa ca anudhammam byākareyya na ca koci sahadhammikaḥ  vāda anuvādaḥ gārayham ṭhānam āgaccheyya
translated: misleading, and contrary to what was said.

original: Ahañhi, vaccha, yāvadeva ākaṅkhāmi anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarāmi,
analyzed: aham hi vaccha yāvat eva ākaṅkhāmi aneka vihitam pubbenivāsam anussarāmi
translated: Because, Vaccha, whenever I want, I recollect my manifold past lives, with aspects and particulars.

original: seyyathidaṁ—ekampi jātiṁ dvepi jātiyo …pe… iti sākāraṁ sauddesaṁ anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarāmi.
analyzed: sā iyyathida ekam pi jātim dve pi jātiyaḥ pe iti sa ākāram sa uddesam aneka vihitam pubbenivāsam anussarāmi
translated: I recollect one life, two lives, three lives, four lives, five lives, ten lives, twenty lives, thirty lives, forty lives, fifty lives, a hundred lives, a thousand lives, a hundred thousand lives, many eons of world-dissolution, many eons of world-evolution, many eons of world-dissolution and world-evolution.🔽I recollect: ‘There, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food.🔽This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended.🔽After passing away from that place, I was reborn somewhere else. There, too, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food.🔽This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended.🔽After passing away from that place, I was reborn here.’🔽In this way I recollect my manifold past lives with aspects and particulars.

original: Ahañhi, vaccha, yāvadeva ākaṅkhāmi dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena
analyzed: aham hi vaccha yāvat eva ākaṅkhāmi dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta mānusakena
translated: Whenever I want, I see — by means of the divine eye, purified and surpassing the human —

original: satte passāmi cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate …pe…
analyzed: satte passāmi cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate pe
translated: beings passing away and being reborn, inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, gone to good destinations and to bad destinations. I understand how beings pass on according to their actions:

original: yathākammūpage satte pajānāmi.
analyzed: yathā kammūpage satte pajānāmi
translated: I know beings according to how they are reborn.🔽I have attained the unexcelled security from bondage

original: Ahañhi, vaccha, āsavānaṁ khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmi.
analyzed: aham hi vacchaḥ āsavānam khayā anāsavam cetaḥ vimuttim paññā vimuttim diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmi
translated: that I sought for so long.🔽If you were to say that the ascetic Gotama is a magician,

original: ‘Tevijjo samaṇo gotamo’ti kho, vaccha, byākaramāno vuttavādī ceva me assa, na ca
analyzed: tevijjaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ iti kho vaccha byākaramānaḥ vutta vādī ca iva me assa na ca
translated: you would be stating what is true of yourself,🔽and you would be misrepresenting the ascetic Gotama as a magician.

original: maṁ abhūtena abbhācikkheyya, dhammassa cānudhammaṁ byākareyya, na ca koci sahadhammiko
analyzed: mam a bhūtena abbhācikkheyya dhammassa ca anudhammam byākareyya na ca koci sahadhammikaḥ
translated: You would be speaking about what you have seen and experienced yourself,

original: vādānuvādo gārayhaṁ ṭhānaṁ āgaccheyyā”ti.
analyzed: vāda anuvādaḥ gārayham ṭhānam āgaccheyya iti
translated: and you would not have a leg to stand on.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, vacchagotto paribbājako bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:🔽“atthi nu kho, bho gotama, koci gihī gihisaṁyojanaṁ appahāya kāyassa bhedā dukkhassantakaro”ti?
analyzed: evam vutte vacchagottaḥ paribbājakaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca  atthi nu kho bho gotama koci gihī gihi sayojanam a pahāya kāyassa bhedā dukkhassa antakaroti
translated: When this was said, the wanderer Vacchagotta said to the Buddha,🔽“Is there any layman who, without giving up the fetters of the householder, has put an end to suffering on the breakup of the body?”

original: “Natthi kho, vaccha, koci gihī gihisaṁyojanaṁ appahāya kāyassa bhedā dukkhassantakaro”ti.
analyzed: natthi kho vaccha koci gihī gihi sayojanam a pahāya kāyassa bhedā dukkhassa antakaroti
translated: “No, Vaccha, there is no layman who, without giving up the fetters of the householder, has put an end to suffering on the breakup of the body.”

original: “Atthi pana, bho gotama, koci gihī gihisaṁyojanaṁ appahāya kāyassa bhedā saggūpago”ti?
analyzed: atthi pana bho gotama koci gihī gihi sayojanam appahāya kāyassa bhedā saggūpago ti
translated: “But, Master Gotama, is there any householder who, without abandoning the fetter of householdership, on the dissolution of the body has made an end of suffering?”

original: “Na kho, vaccha, ekaṁyeva sataṁ na dve satāni na tīṇi satāni na cattāri satāni na pañca satāni, atha kho bhiyyova ye gihī gihisaṁyojanaṁ appahāya kāyassa bhedā saggūpagā”ti.
analyzed: na kho vacchaḥ ekayā iva satam na dve satāni na tīṇi satāni na cattāri satāni na pañca satāni atha kho bhiyyas uva ye gihī gihi sayojanam appahāya kāyassa bhedā saggūpagā ati
translated: “Vaccha, there is not only one hundred, or two hundred, or three hundred, or four hundred, or five hundred, but even more householders who, without abandoning the fetter of householdership, on the dissolution of the body have made an end of suffering.”

original: “Atthi nu kho, bho gotama, koci ājīvako kāyassa bhedā dukkhassantakaro”ti?
analyzed: atthi nu kho bho gotama koci ājīvakaḥ kāyassa bhedā dukkhassa antakaroti
translated: “But, Master Gotama, is there any Ājīvaka who, on the dissolution of the body, has made an end of suffering?”

original: “Natthi kho, vaccha, koci ājīvako kāyassa bhedā dukkhassantakaro”ti.
analyzed: natthi kho vaccha koci ājīvako kāyassa bhedā dukkhassa antakaroti
translated: “Vaccha, there is not a single Ājīvaka who, on the dissolution of the body, has made an end of suffering.”

original: “Atthi pana, bho gotama, koci ājīvako kāyassa bhedā saggūpago”ti?🔽“Ito kho so, vaccha, ekanavuto kappo yamahaṁ anussarāmi, nābhijānāmi kañci ājīvakaṁ saggūpagaṁ aññatra ekena;
analyzed: atthi pana bho gotama koci ājīvako kāyassa bhedā saggūpago ti  itas kho saḥ vaccha ekanavutaḥ kappaḥ yam aham anussarāmi na abhijānāmi kañci ājīvakam saggu upagam aññatra ekena
translated: “But, Master Gotama, is there any Ājīvaka who, on the dissolution of the body, has gone to heaven?”

original: sopāsi kammavādī kiriyavādī”ti.
analyzed: saḥ upāsi kamma vādī kiriya vādī iti
translated: “Vaccha, I do not recall any Ājīvaka who, on the dissolution of the body, has gone to heaven, except for Suppiya the Ājīvaka, who was a proponent of kamma and a proponent of deeds.”

original: “Evaṁ sante, bho gotama, suññaṁ aduṁ titthāyatanaṁ antamaso saggūpagenapī”ti?
analyzed: evam sante bho gotama suññam titthāyatanam antamasaḥ saggūpagena api iti
translated: “Then, Master Gotama, that is a barren shrine, a desolate shrine, a shrine that has gone to the dogs.”

original: “Evaṁ, vaccha, suññaṁ aduṁ titthāyatanaṁ antamaso saggūpagenapī”ti.
analyzed: eva vaccha suññam adum titthāyatanam antamasaḥ saggūpagena api iti
translated: “Vaccha, it is empty, a mere void, a false, hollow pretense, a mere name, a mere description, a mere usage, a mere designation, a mere label, a mere fiction, a mere convention, a mere expression, a mere designation—that is, ‘a brahmin is purified by birth.’ ”

original: Idamavoca bhagavā.
analyzed: idam avoca bhagavān
translated: This is what the Blessed One said.

original: Attamano vacchagotto paribbājako bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinandīti.🔽Tevijjavacchasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ paṭhamaṁ.
analyzed: attamanaḥ vacchagottaḥ paribbājakaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāsitam abhinandi iti 🔽tevijjavaccha suttam niṭṭhitam paṭhama
translated: Pleased, the wanderer Vacchagotta was satisfied with what the Blessed One said.
